content: I have just PRed the proof of the small object argument #20146. Taking into account the content of the draft PRs #20014 and #20079 (which are extremelly technical...), the existence of enough injectives in Grothendieck abelian categories should follow very soon. Using #19986, we shall get that categories of abelian sheaves have enough injectives.

The following declaration in #20079 is now sorry-free:

IsGrothendieckAbelian.enoughInjectives
    {C : Type u} [Category.{v} C] [Abelian C] [IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C] :
    EnoughInjectives C

Thanks to the reviews by @Markus Himmel, most of the following PR (and their many dependent PRs) have been merged in mathlib:

  • #20245: the small object argument (a long series of PRs about mostly about transfinite compositions and attaching cells, API for MorphismProperty)
  • #20014: a "compactness" result for Grothendieck abelian categories: Hom(X, -) commutes with certain colimits
  • #20079: existence of enough injectives in Grothendieck abelian categories
The penultimate PR in this triple series is #22157 (any monomorphism in a Grothendieck abelian category is a transfinite composition of pushouts of monomorphisms in a small family).
Joël Riou has marked this topic as resolved.
